snippet: For Michael Forester and all his family are at the Vicarage ; and a brighter, perhaps so bright a June never glittered on the lone banks of the sweet Heriot Water and the braes of Holylee, as now glitters on Risedale Beck, where- ever its streams and pools are open to the day, among meadows for ever losing themselves in the overshadowing woods of Ellesmere.

snippet: And was Bracken Braes forgotten 1 The green broomy hills and treeless banks of Heriot Water — that one wooded linn, the Howlet's Nest, and he whom her heart had so often heat within her inmost bosom to meet there — Edward Ellis ! No, no — all Lucy's affections were true to the place of her birth ; and sad although she certainly would be when the day came— now near at hand — that they must take their departure from Ellesmere, yet her heart yearned at the forethought towards sweet Scotland, and there, among the banks and braes where she was bom, might she also live, die, and be buried.
